messages.content: द्राक्ष बागेमध्ये किती प्रकारचे कीटक आहेत?
messages.en: How many types of insects are there in a vineyard?
messages.standalone_question: How many types of insects are there in a grape vineyard?
messages.standalone_en: How many types of insects are there in a grape vineyard?
messages.content_transliterated: draks bagemadhye kiti prakarache kitak ahet?

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेमध्ये खालील प्रकारचे कीटक आहेत:

1. अपिड्स (Aphids)
2. बायहार हॅरी कॅटरपिलर (Bihar hairy caterpillar)
3. ब्रॉड माइट्स (Broad mites)
4. ब्राउन प्लांट हॉपर्स (Brown plant hopper)
5. कॅप्सूल बोरर (Capsule borer)
6. कॅटरपिलर (Caterpillar)
7. सिट्रस सायला (Citrus Psylla)
8. कट वर्म (Cut worm)
9. अर्ली शूट बोरर (Early shoot borer)
10. युरोपियन रेड माइट्स (European red mites)
11. फ्लॅट माइट्स (Flat mites)
12. फ्लिया बीटल (Flea Beetle)
13. फ्रूट बोरर (Fruit Borer)
14. फ्रूट फ्लाय (Fruit Fly)
15. ग्रीन अपिड्स (Green aphids)
16. हिस्पा बीटल (Hispa beetle)
17. जॅसिड्स (Jassids)
18. लीफ ईटिंग कॅटरपिलर (Leaf eating caterpillar)
19. लीफ फोल्डर (Leaf folder)
20. लीफ माइनर (Leaf miner)
21. लीफ रोलर (Leaf roller)
22. मँगो हॉपर्स (Mango hopper)
23. मीली बग (Mealy Bug)
24. माइट्स (Mites)
25. पिन वर्म (Pin worm)
26. पिंक बॉलवॉर्म (Pink bollworm)
27. रेड स्पायडर माइट्स (Red Spider Mites)
28. राईझोम वील (Rhizome weevil)
29. रूट ग्रब्स (Root Grubs)
30. रूट नॉट नेमाटोड (Root knot nematode)
31. स्पोडोप्टेरा (Spodoptera)
32. स्टेम बोरर (Stem Borer)
33. थ्रिप्स (Thrips)
34. व्हाइट फ्लाय (White Fly)

या सर्व कीटक द्राक्ष बागेमध्ये आढळू शकतात.
messages.en:
The following types of pests are found in the vineyard:

1. Aphids
2. Bihar hairy caterpillar
3. Broad mites
4. Brown plant hopper
5. Capsule borer
6. Caterpillar
7. Citrus Psylla
8. Cut worm
9. Early shoot borer
10. European red mites
11. Flat mites
12. Flea Beetle
13. Fruit Borer
14. Fruit Fly
15. Green aphids
16. Hispa beetle
17. Jassids
18. Leaf eating caterpillar
19. Leaf folder
20. Leaf miner
21. Leaf roller
22. Mango hoppers
23. Mealy Bug
24. Mites
25. Pin worm
26. Pink bollworm
27. Red Spider Mites
28. Rhizome weevil
29. Root Grubs
30. Root knot nematode
31. Spodoptera
32. Stem Borer
33. Thrips
34. White Fly

All these insects can be found in the vine garden.

messages.content: द्राक्ष बागेतील कीटक नाश करण्याकरिता कोणते कीटकनाशक वापरले जाऊ शकतात
messages.en: What pesticides can be used to kill insects in vineyards
messages.standalone_question: What insecticides can be used to eliminate pests in grape vineyards?
messages.standalone_en: What insecticides can be used to eliminate pests in grape vineyards?

faq:
Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

messages.content_transliterated: draks bagetil kitak nash karanyakarita conte kitakanashak vaparale jaau shakatat

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेतील कीटक नाश करण्यासाठी खालील कीटकनाशकांचा वापर केला जाऊ शकतो:

1. **इमिडाक्लोप्रिड (Imidacloprid)** - हे एक व्यापक कीटकनाशक आहे, जे अनेक प्रकारच्या कीटकांवर प्रभावी आहे.
2. **थायमिथोक्सम (Thiamethoxam)** - हे कीटकांवर प्रभावी असून, विशेषतः अपिड्स आणि थ्रिप्ससारख्या कीटकांवर वापरले जाते.
3. **क्लोरपायरीफॉस (Chlorpyrifos)** - हे एक सामान्य कीटकनाशक आहे, जे विविध कीटकांवर प्रभावी आहे.
4. **स्पिनोसाड (Spinosad)** - हे जैविक कीटकनाशक आहे, जे थ्रिप्स आणि इतर कीटकांवर प्रभावी आहे.
5. **पायरेथ्रॉइड्स (Pyrethroids)** - हे एक समूह आहे कीटकनाशकांचा, जे विविध कीटकांवर प्रभावी असतात.

या कीटकनाशकांचा वापर करताना, योग्य प्रमाण आणि वापराच्या पद्धतींचा विचार करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. तसेच, स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घेणे देखील उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.
messages.en:
The following pesticides can be used to kill insects in vineyards:

1. **Imidacloprid (Imidacloprid)** - It is a widespread pesticide, which is effective against many types of insects.
2. **Thymethoxam (Thiamethoxam)** - It is effective on insects, especially used on insects such as epidips and thrips.
3. **Chlorpyrifos (Chlorpyrifos)** - It is a common pesticide, which is effective on various insects.
4. **Spinosad)** - It is a biological pesticide, which is effective on thrips and other insects.
5. **Pyrethroids** - This is a group of pesticides, which are effective against various insects.

When using these pesticides, it is important to consider the right quantity and methods of use. Also, it may be helpful to consult a local agricultural expert.

messages.content: द्राक्ष बागेला किती प्रकारच्या बुरशा येऊ शकतात
messages.en: What kinds of burrows can come to the vineyard?
messages.standalone_question: How many types of fungi can affect a grape vineyard?
messages.standalone_en: How many types of fungi can affect a grape vineyard?
messages.content_transliterated: draks bagela kiti prakarachya bursha yeu shakatat

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेला खालील प्रकारच्या बुरशा येऊ शकतात:

1. **अल्टरनारिया (Alternaria)** - पानांवर काळे ठिपके तयार करतो.
2. **अँथ्रॅक्नोज (Anthracnose)** - फळांवर काळे किंवा भुरे ठिपके तयार करतो.
3. **डाऊनी मिल्ड्यू (Downy Mildew)** - पानांच्या तळाशी पांढरे किंवा पांढरे धुके तयार करतो.
4. **ग्रे मोल्ड (Grey Mold)** - फळांवर आणि पानांवर ग्रे रंगाचा कव्हर तयार करतो.
5. **फ्युसेरियम विल्ट (Fusarium Wilt)** - वनस्पतींच्या मुळांवर परिणाम करतो, ज्यामुळे वनस्पती मरण पावतात.
6. **पावडरी मिल्ड्यू (Powdery Mildew)** - पानांवर पांढरे धुके तयार करतो.
7. **लेट ब्लाइट (Late Blight)** - पानांवर काळे ठिपके आणि सड येतो.

या बुरशांमुळे द्राक्षांच्या उत्पादनावर गंभीर परिणाम होऊ शकतो, त्यामुळे योग्य नियंत्रण आणि उपचार आवश्यक आहेत.
messages.en:
The following types of burrows can occur in a vineyard:

1. **Alternaria** - Forms black dots on the leaves.
2. **Anthracnose*** - Forms black or brown dots on the fruit.
3. **Downy Mildew)** - Forms white or white mist at the bottom of the leaves.
4. **Grey Mold** - Forms a grey cover on fruits and leaves.
5. **Fusarium wilt** - Affects the roots of plants, causing plant death.
6. **Powdery mildew** - Produces white mist on the leaves.
7. **Late Blight** - Leaves have black dots and rot.

These fungi can have a serious impact on the production of grapes, so proper control and treatment are necessary.

messages.content: सर्व प्रकारच्या बुरशी नाश करण्याकरता कोणते बुरशीनाशक वापरावे
messages.en: Which fungicide to use to kill all types of fungi
messages.standalone_question: What fungicides can be used to eliminate all types of fungi?
messages.standalone_en: What fungicides can be used to eliminate all types of fungi?

faq:
Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

messages.content_transliterated: serve prakarachya burshi nash karanyakarata conte burashinashak vaparave

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेतील सर्व प्रकारच्या बुरशा नाश करण्यासाठी खालील बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर केला जाऊ शकतो:

1. **फ्लुट्रिमॉक्सायन (Flutriafol)** - विविध बुरशांवर प्रभावी आहे, विशेषतः पावडरी मिल्ड्यू आणि डाऊनी मिल्ड्यूवर.
2. **बोर्डो मिश्रण (Bordeaux Mixture)** - हे एक पारंपरिक बुरशीनाशक आहे, जे विविध बुरशांवर प्रभावी आहे.
3. **कॅप्टन (Captan)** - हे बुरशांवर प्रभावी असून, विशेषतः फळांवर येणाऱ्या बुरशांवर वापरले जाते.
4. **थिराम (Thiram)** - हे बुरशांवर प्रभावी असून, बुरशीजन्य रोगांच्या नियंत्रणासाठी वापरले जाते.
5. **मेटालॅक्सिल (Metalaxyl)** - विशेषतः डाऊनी मिल्ड्यूवर प्रभावी आहे.

या बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करताना, योग्य प्रमाण आणि वापराच्या पद्धतींचा विचार करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. तसेच, स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घेणे देखील उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.
messages.en:
The following fungicides can be used to destroy all types of fungi in vineyards:

1. **Flutrimoxin (Flutriafol)** - Effective on a variety of fungi, especially powdery mildew and downey mildew.
2. **Bordeaux Mixture** - It is a traditional fungicide, which is effective against various fungicides.
3. **Captain (Captan)** - It is effective on bursaries, especially those that come on fruits.
4. **Thiram (Thiram)** - It is effective against fungi and is used for the control of fungal diseases.
5. **Metalaxyl** - Especially effective on downy mildew.

When using these fungicides, it is important to consider the right quantity and methods of use. Also, it may be helpful to consult a local agricultural expert.

messages.content: द्राक्ष बागेतील पानांच्या वाट्या होत असतील तर काय समजावे
messages.en: What to know if there are bowls of leaves in a vineyard
messages.standalone_question: What does it indicate if the leaves of a grapevine are curling?
messages.standalone_en: What does it indicate if the leaves of a grapevine are curling?
messages.content_transliterated: draks bagetil pananchya vatya hot asatil tar kay samajave

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेतील पानांच्या वाट्या होणे म्हणजे पानांच्या कडांवर किंवा मध्यभागी पांढरे किंवा पिवळे ठिपके किंवा रेषा दिसणे. यामुळे खालील कारणे असू शकतात:

1. **बुरशीजन्य रोग**: पावडरी मिल्ड्यू किंवा डाऊनी मिल्ड्यू सारख्या बुरशांमुळे पानांच्या वाट्या होऊ शकतात.
2. **पोषणाची कमतरता**: विशेषतः नायट्रोजन, जस्त किंवा मॅग्नेशियमच्या कमतरतेमुळे पानांच्या वाट्या होऊ शकतात.
3. **कीटकांचा प्रादुर्भाव**: अपिड्स किंवा थ्रिप्स सारख्या कीटकांमुळे पानांच्या कडांवर नुकसान होऊ शकते.
4. **पाण्याची कमतरता**: पाण्याची कमी किंवा अनियमित पाण्याचा पुरवठा पानांच्या आरोग्यावर परिणाम करू शकतो.

या समस्येवर उपाय म्हणून, योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर, पोषणाची तपासणी, आणि कीटक नियंत्रणाची पद्धत वापरणे आवश्यक आहे. स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घेणे देखील उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.
messages.en:
Leaf bowls in a vineyard are the appearance of white or yellow dots or lines on the edges or center of the leaves. This may cause the following:

1. **Fungal disease**: Fungi such as powdered mildew or downy mildew can cause leaf bowls.
2. **Nutritional deficiencies**: Deficiency of nitrogen, zinc, or magnesium in particular can cause leaf bowls.
3. **Insect infestation**: Insects such as apids or thrips can cause damage to the edges of the leaves.
4. **Water scarcity**: Low or irregular water supply of water can affect the health of the leaves.

To address this problem, it is necessary to use proper fungicides, nutritional screening, and methods of pest control. It may also be helpful to consult a local agricultural expert.

The following pesticides can be used to kill insects in vineyards:

1. **Imidacloprid (Imidacloprid)** - It is a widespread pesticide, which is effective against many types of insects.
2. **Thymethoxam (Thiamethoxam)** - It is effective on insects, especially used on insects such as epidips and thrips.
3. **Chlorpyrifos (Chlorpyrifos)** - It is a common pesticide, which is effective on various insects.
4. **Spinosad)** - It is a biological pesticide, which is effective on thrips and other insects.
5. **Pyrethroids** - This is a group of pesticides, which are effective against various insects.

When using these pesticides, it is important to consider the right quantity and methods of use. Also, it may be helpful to consult a local agricultural expert.

messages.content: द्राक्ष बागेला किती प्रकारच्या बुरशा येऊ शकतात
messages.en: What kinds of burrows can come to the vineyard?
messages.standalone_question: How many types of fungi can affect a grape vineyard?
messages.standalone_en: How many types of fungi can affect a grape vineyard?
messages.content_transliterated: draks bagela kiti prakarachya bursha yeu shakatat

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेला खालील प्रकारच्या बुरशा येऊ शकतात:

1. **अल्टरनारिया (Alternaria)** - पानांवर काळे ठिपके तयार करतो.
2. **अँथ्रॅक्नोज (Anthracnose)** - फळांवर काळे किंवा भुरे ठिपके तयार करतो.
3. **डाऊनी मिल्ड्यू (Downy Mildew)** - पानांच्या तळाशी पांढरे किंवा पांढरे धुके तयार करतो.
4. **ग्रे मोल्ड (Grey Mold)** - फळांवर आणि पानांवर ग्रे रंगाचा कव्हर तयार करतो.
5. **फ्युसेरियम विल्ट (Fusarium Wilt)** - वनस्पतींच्या मुळांवर परिणाम करतो, ज्यामुळे वनस्पती मरण पावतात.
6. **पावडरी मिल्ड्यू (Powdery Mildew)** - पानांवर पांढरे धुके तयार करतो.
7. **लेट ब्लाइट (Late Blight)** - पानांवर काळे ठिपके आणि सड येतो.

या बुरशांमुळे द्राक्षांच्या उत्पादनावर गंभीर परिणाम होऊ शकतो, त्यामुळे योग्य नियंत्रण आणि उपचार आवश्यक आहेत.
messages.en:
The following types of burrows can occur in a vineyard:

1. **Alternaria** - Forms black dots on the leaves.
2. **Anthracnose*** - Forms black or brown dots on the fruit.
3. **Downy Mildew)** - Forms white or white mist at the bottom of the leaves.
4. **Grey Mold** - Forms a grey cover on fruits and leaves.
5. **Fusarium wilt** - Affects the roots of plants, causing plant death.
6. **Powdery mildew** - Produces white mist on the leaves.
7. **Late Blight** - Leaves have black dots and rot.

These fungi can have a serious impact on the production of grapes, so proper control and treatment are necessary.

messages.content: सर्व प्रकारच्या बुरशी नाश करण्याकरता कोणते बुरशीनाशक वापरावे
messages.en: Which fungicide to use to kill all types of fungi
messages.standalone_question: What fungicides can be used to eliminate all types of fungi?
messages.standalone_en: What fungicides can be used to eliminate all types of fungi?

faq:
Q: Can fungicide and insecticide be sprayed together?
A: For fungicides and insecticides to be sprayed together, it is important to consider factors like compatibility. For expert guidance tailored to your situation, we recommend reaching out to Fyllo’s CRM number for personalized advice.

messages.content_transliterated: serve prakarachya burshi nash karanyakarata conte burashinashak vaparave

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेतील सर्व प्रकारच्या बुरशा नाश करण्यासाठी खालील बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर केला जाऊ शकतो:

1. **फ्लुट्रिमॉक्सायन (Flutriafol)** - विविध बुरशांवर प्रभावी आहे, विशेषतः पावडरी मिल्ड्यू आणि डाऊनी मिल्ड्यूवर.
2. **बोर्डो मिश्रण (Bordeaux Mixture)** - हे एक पारंपरिक बुरशीनाशक आहे, जे विविध बुरशांवर प्रभावी आहे.
3. **कॅप्टन (Captan)** - हे बुरशांवर प्रभावी असून, विशेषतः फळांवर येणाऱ्या बुरशांवर वापरले जाते.
4. **थिराम (Thiram)** - हे बुरशांवर प्रभावी असून, बुरशीजन्य रोगांच्या नियंत्रणासाठी वापरले जाते.
5. **मेटालॅक्सिल (Metalaxyl)** - विशेषतः डाऊनी मिल्ड्यूवर प्रभावी आहे.

या बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर करताना, योग्य प्रमाण आणि वापराच्या पद्धतींचा विचार करणे महत्त्वाचे आहे. तसेच, स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घेणे देखील उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.
messages.en:
The following fungicides can be used to destroy all types of fungi in vineyards:

1. **Flutrimoxin (Flutriafol)** - Effective on a variety of fungi, especially powdery mildew and downey mildew.
2. **Bordeaux Mixture** - It is a traditional fungicide, which is effective against various fungicides.
3. **Captain (Captan)** - It is effective on bursaries, especially those that come on fruits.
4. **Thiram (Thiram)** - It is effective against fungi and is used for the control of fungal diseases.
5. **Metalaxyl** - Especially effective on downy mildew.

When using these fungicides, it is important to consider the right quantity and methods of use. Also, it may be helpful to consult a local agricultural expert.

messages.content: द्राक्ष बागेतील पानांच्या वाट्या होत असतील तर काय समजावे
messages.en: What to know if there are bowls of leaves in a vineyard
messages.standalone_question: What does it indicate if the leaves of the grapevine are curling?
messages.standalone_en: What does it indicate if the leaves of the grapevine are curling?
messages.content_transliterated: draks bagetil pananchya vatya hot asatil tar kay samajave

messages.content:
द्राक्ष बागेतील पानांच्या वाट्या होणे म्हणजे पानांच्या कडांवर किंवा मध्यभागी पांढरे किंवा पिवळे ठिपके किंवा रेषा दिसणे. यामुळे खालील कारणे असू शकतात:

1. **बुरशीजन्य रोग**: पावडरी मिल्ड्यू किंवा डाऊनी मिल्ड्यू सारख्या बुरशांमुळे पानांच्या वाट्या होऊ शकतात.
2. **पोषणाची कमतरता**: विशेषतः नायट्रोजन, जस्त किंवा मॅग्नेशियमच्या कमतरतेमुळे पानांच्या वाट्या होऊ शकतात.
3. **कीटकांचा प्रादुर्भाव**: अपिड्स किंवा थ्रिप्स सारख्या कीटकांमुळे पानांच्या कडांवर नुकसान होऊ शकते.
4. **पाण्याची कमतरता**: पाण्याची कमी किंवा अनियमित पाण्याचा पुरवठा पानांच्या आरोग्यावर परिणाम करू शकतो.

या समस्येवर उपाय म्हणून, योग्य बुरशीनाशकांचा वापर, पोषणाची तपासणी, आणि कीटक नियंत्रणाची पद्धत वापरणे आवश्यक आहे. स्थानिक कृषी तज्ञांचा सल्ला घेणे देखील उपयुक्त ठरू शकते.
messages.en:
Leaf bowls in a vineyard are the appearance of white or yellow dots or lines on the edges or center of the leaves. This may cause the following:

1. **Fungal disease**: Fungi such as powdered mildew or downy mildew can cause leaf bowls.
2. **Nutritional deficiencies**: Deficiency of nitrogen, zinc, or magnesium in particular can cause leaf bowls.
3. **Insect infestation**: Insects such as apids or thrips can cause damage to the edges of the leaves.
4. **Water scarcity**: Low or irregular water supply of water can affect the health of the leaves.

To address this problem, it is necessary to use proper fungicides, nutritional screening, and methods of pest control. It may also be helpful to consult a local agricultural expert.

messages.content: My sensor has been zero for two months, what fertilizer can I add now?
messages.en: My sensor has been zero for two months, what fertilizer can I add now?
messages.standalone_question: What fertilizer can I add now if my sensor has been at zero for two months?
messages.standalone_en: What fertilizer can I add now if my sensor has been at zero for two months?

faq:
Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: My  sensor is showing 0 Kpa for long.
A: 0-5 kPa means wet soil. It can be due to following :
If the device is recently installed, there can be moisture  around the sensor because the sensor is dipped in the water before installing. If this is the case, ask them to do atleast 3 irrigations as per their previous schedule without sensors and sensors would b set by then.
If the crop stage is very early or pruing is done recently, the water takeup by plants is negligible in this period because of very less transpiration. If this is the case, ask them to wait till irrigation Kpa in the present stage.
Sometimes, the water can remain accumulated around the sensor due to local landscaping or slope in the land around sensor. In this case, please check the around the sensor. It will have to be reinstalled properly. Chatbot should ask the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is showing dry.
A: Ask user when he irrigated. It usually takes 12 hours to reach the water till sensor. If the sensor is not dropping even after 12 hours, it can be due to one of the following reasons :
Water is not reaching properly till the sensor , this can be due to drip blocked , or slope in the land or dripper outlets far away from the sensor. Ask user to check if drip is fine and  dripper is within the range of sensor. 
The sensor can be very old , more than two years , in this case , the sensor might be malfunction, ask user if he wants to raise a ticket

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: Sensor is showing dry, but it rained recently.
A: Rainwater doesn't percolate well in the soil. Most of it runs off. After a day of rain stops , if the sensor is still dry, you will have to irrigate. You can check the moisture by digging near the sensor . Irrigate accordingly.

messages.content:
Since your sensor has been showing 0 kPa for two months, it indicates that the soil is very wet. Before adding any fertilizer, it's essential to ensure that the soil moisture levels are appropriate for nutrient uptake.

Let's first check your current crop stage and the fertigation schedule for your Dragon Fruit plot. I'll retrieve that information for you.:

Currently, your Dragon Fruit is in the "Fruit Set" stage, which started on May 15, 2025. As of now, there is no fertigation needed for this week.

However, the next stage is "Alternate Harvest," and you can prepare for that. Here are some fertilizer options you can consider for the upcoming stage:

1. **Soil Application:**
   - **10-26-26**: 134.5 kg/acre
   - **Urea**: 85 kg/acre
   - **Muriate of Potash**: 25.5 kg/acre

   OR

   - **12-32-16**: 109 kg/acre
   - **Urea**: 85.5 kg/acre
   - **Muriate of Potash**: 55 kg/acre

   OR

   - **Urea**: 114 kg/acre
   - **18-46-0 (Diammonium phosphate)**: 76 kg/acre
   - **Muriate of Potash**: 84 kg/acre

2. **Fertigation:**
   - **12-61-0**: 4 kg/acre
   - **Urea**: 4.5 kg/acre
   - **Magnesium Sulphate**: 2 kg/acre

   OR

   - **24-24-0**: 11.5 kg/acre
   - **Magnesium Sulphate**: 2 kg/acre

   OR

   - **Urea**: 5.5 kg/acre
   - **Phosphoric acid 80%**: 3.5 kg/acre
   - **Magnesium Sulphate**: 2 kg/acre

**Note:** Phosphoric acid should be applied separately, 15-20 minutes before the application of other fertilizers.

Before applying any fertilizers, ensure that the soil moisture levels are appropriate for nutrient uptake. If the soil remains too wet, it may be best to wait until the moisture levels stabilize. Would you like to proceed with any specific fertilizer application?

messages.content: Can we do fertigation when the sensor is showing zero?
messages.en: Can we do fertigation when the sensor is showing zero?
messages.standalone_question: Is it possible to perform fertigation when the sensor is indicating zero?
messages.standalone_en: Is it possible to perform fertigation when the sensor is indicating zero?

faq:
Q: In the latest irrigation , sensor didn't drop to 0.
A: 0 to 5 Kpa means soil is fully wet. It need not drop to 0 every time. Moisture less than 5 also means wet conditions. So, need not worry. Also ask to wait for 12 hours after irrigation.

Q: My  sensor is showing 0 Kpa for long.
A: 0-5 kPa means wet soil. It can be due to following :
If the device is recently installed, there can be moisture  around the sensor because the sensor is dipped in the water before installing. If this is the case, ask them to do atleast 3 irrigations as per their previous schedule without sensors and sensors would b set by then.
If the crop stage is very early or pruing is done recently, the water takeup by plants is negligible in this period because of very less transpiration. If this is the case, ask them to wait till irrigation Kpa in the present stage.
Sometimes, the water can remain accumulated around the sensor due to local landscaping or slope in the land around sensor. In this case, please check the around the sensor. It will have to be reinstalled properly. Chatbot should ask the user if he wants to create an issue ticket for the same

Q: I irrigated still the sensor is dropping slowly.
A: Sometimes, the water reaches slowly till root zone and the moisture sensor kPa value drops slowly. Always wait for 12 hours after irrigation for the moisture to saturate. If still some confusion, ask user to check moisture near the sensor and check if he wants to raise a ticket for the issue.

Q: How do I know if my soil  moisture sensor is working fine ?
A: The only way to know is if after irrigation the sensor is dropping below 5 kpa and increasing continuously unless next irrigation is done. You can try putting water on the sensor and it should drop. Also, there should not be any fluctuations in the soil moisture data and the pressure kpa should always be increasing. Also, a soil moisture reading of 0 kPa is perfectly fine, meaning wet soil, but a reading of 200 kPa could mean fault. If the soil moisture sensor reading is consistently at 0 from few 48 hours, then it could be anamolous (use live and historical hourly soil moisture data (use tool) to validate).

Q: Sensor is showing wet, i.e. less kpa but soil looks dry.
A: The sensor measures the moisture around the rootzone which is not visible from the top. Ask use to check the moisture in rootzone around the sensor. If it matches, ask the user to irrigate.

messages.content:
Yes, you can perform fertigation when the soil moisture sensor shows a reading of zero (0 kPa), as this indicates that the soil is fully wet. However, it's essential to ensure that the soil moisture levels are appropriate for nutrient uptake. 

After fertigation, it's advisable to wait for about 12 hours for the moisture to stabilize before checking the sensor again. If you have any specific fertilizer in mind or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
messages.en:
Yes, you can perform fertigation when the soil moisture sensor shows a reading of zero (0 kPa), as this indicates that the soil is fully wet. However, it's essential to ensure that the soil moisture levels are appropriate for nutrient uptake. 

After fertigation, it's advisable to wait for about 12 hours for the moisture to stabilize before checking the sensor again. If you have any specific fertilizer in mind or need further assistance, feel free to ask!
